data.title: Quarter 1 - Module 2: The Majestic Architecture and Sculpture of Luzon
data.meta_description: Arts 2 - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. The document discusses arts and architecture from Luzon, the largest island of the Philippines. It describes several iconic structures from Luzon, including Calle Crisologo, a narrow 15th century Spanish street in Vigan, Ilocos Sur lined with antique houses and considered a heritage site. It also describes Tumauini Church, a late Baroque-style church built in 1873 in Isabela province entirely of red bricks with a four-story bell tower. Additionally, it mentions the Spanish Gate in Olongapo City, built in 1885 to serve as the entrance to the original Spanish naval station.
data.text: Quarter 1 - Module 2: The Majestic Architecture and Sculpture of Luzon
